<!-- source-hash: fc162e049cd90548eabd0db997e1c1cd -->
REST controller for managing system logs with comprehensive querying, filtering, and detail retrieval capabilities. Provides paginated access to logs with multiple filter options and audit trail functionality.

## Key Components

**Main Controller Class:**
- `LogController` - REST controller mapped to `/api/v1/logs`

**Dependencies:**
- `LogService` - Core service for log operations
- `LogMapper` - Maps between DTOs and domain objects

**Key Endpoints:**
- `GET /api/v1/logs` - Query logs with filtering and pagination
- `GET /api/v1/logs/filters` - Get available filter options
- `GET /api/v1/logs/details` - Retrieve specific log entry details

**Filter Parameters:**
- Date range (startDate/endDate), tool types, event types, severities
- Organization IDs, device ID, search text, pagination controls

## Usage Example

```java
// Query logs with filters
@Autowired
private LogController logController;

// Get paginated logs with filters
LogsResponse logs = logController.getLogs(
    LocalDate.of(2024, 1, 1),  // startDate
    LocalDate.of(2024, 1, 31), // endDate
    List.of("security", "audit"), // toolTypes
    List.of("login", "logout"),   // eventTypes
    List.of("HIGH", "CRITICAL"),  // severities
    List.of("org-123"),           // organizationIds
    "device-456",                 // deviceId
    "failed login",               // search
    50,                          // limit
    "cursor123",                 // cursor
    "user-789",                  // userId (header)
    "api-key-456"                // apiKeyId (header)
);

// Get available filter options
LogFilterResponse filters = logController.getLogFilters(
    LocalDate.now().minusDays(30), // startDate
    LocalDate.now(),               // endDate
    null, null, null, null,        // other filters
    "user-789", "api-key-456"      // headers
);
```
